ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

Number of newly diagnosed people with HIV in the past 12 months
Number of patients with HIV receiving Antiretroviral therapy (ART) at the clinic (cumulative to the date of this assessment)
Number of patients with HIV newly initiated on Antiretroviral therapy (ART) in the past 12 months
Number of patients with HIV who dropped out from Antiretroviral therapy (ART) in the past 12 months (include patients who later returned and patients who did not return)
Number of patients with HIV who had previously dropped out from Antiretroviral therapy (ART) and returned in the past 12 months (the patients may have dropped out before the start of the year)

Please estimate the percentage of patients with HIV that receive their Antiretroviral therapy (ART) pills: Every 3 months
Please estimate the percentage of patients with HIV that receive their Antiretroviral therapy (ART) pills: Other
How often does the clinic distribute ARV drugs to patients with HIV?
Notes: 1=Every working day; 2=Two working days in a week; 3=Three working days in a week; 4=Other
